    AUKI

    Black seed oil was said to have been Cleopatra's beauty secret. A playful take on this mythology and the ancient wisdom of its carefully sourced Egyptian ingredients.

    • Branding
    • Packaging

    Bark Architects

    A rebrand to embody their responsive work to the Noosa landscape and surrounds, the Bark website highlights their public and private architectural projects. Each project tells a story, incorporating initial sketches, plot stats, blueprints and writings with the final work beautifully realised and photographed.

    • UI UX
    • Rebrand
      • barkdesign.com.au

    PIG CINÉ

    A curated collection of all unusual films playing across Brisbane in one online space to increase awareness and attendance at these under-publicised events and build a community amongst film goers. In partnership with MetroArts, PIG CINÉ went on to host free film screenings featuring the work of both local and international film makers.

    • UI UX
    • Branding
    • Development
    • Wordpress
    • Responsive
    • Co-Founder

    Bessa

    Sweet simple line work for a coffee truck in Milton.

    Heirloom

    Originally working in pure CMYK to cut on costs, magenta, blue and black went on to colour code the different types of organic chocolate used in the Heirloom family. A fun fresh take on drinking chocolate.

    UAP

    It was very special to work with the behemoth creative that is Urban Art Projects. Together we made a website that celebrated their vibrant and extensive folio of public works around the world. The end result was an absolute beast of a site, carefully indexing tonnes of content showcasing their builds and collaborators, also available in Mandarin for their growing international operations.

    Hi my name is Pamela, I'm a designer and now developer who's been working in the space of digital design and branding for over 10 years.

    I'm a bit of an alien but I have an open mind and I love a good challenge. My design practice and experience spans across multiple disciplines because I enjoy the flexibility of being able to do all the things and evolving alongside new technologies, most recently in the areas of full-stack development and 3D. I’ve spent the last 4 years freelancing and starting DIY non-for-profit projects within my local arts, music and film community in Meanjin Brisbane. Fostering underground culture and community is at the centre of what I love to do. I am also a ceramic artist making one-of-a-kind lamps under the moniker Queena Grot and play in a punk band called Guppy.

    Pamela sits in her faithful computer chair in her room.

    To recognise that I live, work and benefit from systems built on stolen Jagera and Turrbal country is an important step towards true reconcilliation with First Nations people, the traditional owners of this land. Without recognition of their wisdom and eternal connection to country we risk being stuck in cycles of the past and never truly moving forward together with the kind of grace that would benefit everyone in this country and is worth fighting for.

    Pamela C 2022
